clean_content:
Definition / general

* Congenital granular cell tumor of alveolar mucosa of jaw in newborns* 90% girls; 10% present as multiple lesions* Doesn't recur, even if incompletely excised* 0.5 - 2 cm soft, pedunculated mucosal mass* Spontaneously regresses over first 8 months of life ([Am J Surg Pathol 1981;5:37](6264813))

Terminology

* Congenital granular cell myoblastoma, granular cell epulis of infancy and granular cell fibroblastoma

Sites

* Exclusively on anterior alveolar ridge of maxilla and mandible, usually overlying future canine and lateral incisor teeth

Case reports

* Newborn girl with 2 cm tumor ([Pediatrics 2001;107:E22](11158496))* 2 day old girl with 4 x 2 cm exophytic growth ([Pan Afr Med J 2012;12:105](23133705))* 3 week old girl with spontaneous regression ([J Med Case Rep 2010;4:331](20964807))* 3 week old girl had a pedunculated lesion of the anterior maxillary alveolar process, which was excised ([Case of the Month #524](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case524.htm))

Clinical images

Contributed by Dhiraj B. Nikumbh, M.B.B.S., M.D.  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh01.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh01.jpg)

2 day old girl with  
 difficulty eating and  
 breathing due to  
 upper jaw lesion

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:   

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityepulisclinical1.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2974747/figure/F1/)

Lesion at 3 weeks

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityepulisclinical2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC2974747/figure/F2/)

Lesion at 16 months

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityepulisclinical3.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3489388/figure/F0001/)

Tumor arising from anterior maxillary alveolus

Gross images

Contributed by Dhiraj B. Nikumbh, M.B.B.S., M.D.  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh02.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh02.jpg)

Congenital granular cell tumor

Microscopic (histologic) description

* Confluent to nodular submucosal growth of tumors composed of large polygonal cells with eosinophilic granular cytoplasm and small central nuclei* Overlying epithelium is atrophic; does NOT show pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia (common with granular cell tumor of adults)

Microscopic (histologic) images

Contributed by Dhiraj B. Nikumbh, M.B.B.S., M.D. and Kelly Magliocca, D.D.S., M.P.H. ([Case #524](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/case524.htm))  

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh03.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh03.jpg)

Stratified squamous epithelium

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh04.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh04.jpg)

Abundant granular eosinophilic cytoplasm

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh05.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/imgau/oralcavityepulisNikumbh05.jpg)

S100

  

[![Scanning magnification](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img1.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img1.jpg)

Scanning magnification

[![Stroma and overlying surface epithelium](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img2.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img2.jpg)

Stroma and overlying surface epithelium

[![Sheet-like growth](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img3.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img3.jpg)

Sheet-like growth

[![Granular stromal cells](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img4.jpg)](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/caseofweek/Case524img4.jpg)

Granular stromal cells

  
  
Images hosted on other servers:   

[![](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/thumb/oralcavityepulismicro2.jpg)](https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3489388/figure/F0002/)

Polygonal cells

Negative stains

* [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html) (in contrast to granular cell tumor of adults), **laminin**, [Leu7](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/cdmarkerscd57.html), [NSE](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainsNSE.html)

Differential diagnosis

* [Granular cell tumor](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/softtissuegranularcell.html):
  + Adults, infiltrates deep tissues, overlying epithelial hyperplasia+ [S100](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/stainss100.html)+* [Verruciform xanthoma](https://www.pathologyoutlines.com/topic/oralcavityverruciformxanthoma.html):
    + Adults, overlying papillomatosis
